body_html:
@goldsborough I got myself an x86 system with GPU and built pytorch from scratch, looks like it also happens on x86 and fails. It seems the problem is the line : CXX_FLAGS = [] if sys.platform == 'win32' else ['-g', '-Werror']

Which is being used in both the CppExtension and CUDAExtension in setup.py . The side effect of this is it adds the extra : -DTORCH_API_INCLUDE_EXTENSION_H -DTORCH_EXTENSION_NAME=cuda to the CppExtension build. And that errors out because TORCH_EXTENSION_NAME is being redifined.

If I do something like:

ext_modules = [
CppExtension(
'torch_test_cpp_extension.cpp', ['extension.cpp'],
extra_compile_args=[] if sys.platform == 'win32' else ['-g', '-Werror']),
]

that works fine.
body_text:
@goldsborough I got myself an x86 system with GPU and built pytorch from scratch,  looks like it also happens on x86 and fails.   It seems the problem is the line : CXX_FLAGS = [] if sys.platform == 'win32' else ['-g', '-Werror']
Which is being used in both the CppExtension and CUDAExtension in setup.py .   The side effect of this is it adds the extra :  -DTORCH_API_INCLUDE_EXTENSION_H -DTORCH_EXTENSION_NAME=cuda  to the CppExtension build.    And that errors out because TORCH_EXTENSION_NAME is being redifined.
If I do something like:
ext_modules = [
CppExtension(
'torch_test_cpp_extension.cpp', ['extension.cpp'],
extra_compile_args=[] if sys.platform == 'win32' else ['-g', '-Werror']),
]
that works fine.
body:
@goldsborough I got myself an x86 system with GPU and built pytorch from scratch,  looks like it also happens on x86 and fails.   It seems the problem is the line : CXX_FLAGS = [] if sys.platform == 'win32' else ['-g', '-Werror']

Which is being used in both the CppExtension and CUDAExtension in setup.py .   The side effect of this is it adds the extra :  -DTORCH_API_INCLUDE_EXTENSION_H -DTORCH_EXTENSION_NAME=cuda  to the CppExtension build.    And that errors out because TORCH_EXTENSION_NAME is being redifined.

If I do something like: 

ext_modules = [
    CppExtension(
        'torch_test_cpp_extension.cpp', ['extension.cpp'],
        extra_compile_args=[] if sys.platform == 'win32' else ['-g', '-Werror']),
]

that works fine.
